content.label: Interesting gameplay and beautiful art. There are audio settings available but it seems to have no sounds at all. Is that intentional or a bug? Occurring on both iPhone8 and iPad.
Glitchy. Keeps loosing my forward progress if I leave the game. Also will just close for no reason...and then my progress is gone unless I have finished a chapter.

Beautiful artwork, but like other reviews have mentioned. For the first 50% of the game, the puzzles are just about clicking around until you find the solution. There‚Äôs no complexity to the puzzles until the last half and even that is quite simple. A beautiful design but too short. If there was another couple chapters like the final 2, it would have been much better.
Jhbn
I was amazed by this game.  Thank you for providing me this much entertainment!

By far the most beautiful puzzle app I‚Äôve played, and clearly loved and carefully crafted by its artist(s).  My favorite part is that it came with no instruction, so it‚Äôs a puzzle from the very start.  You are truly forced to use your imagination and think outside the box every moment.  The format is also very unique.  If I could give more than 5 stars, I would.  Worth the couple dollars!
Truly innovate and breathtaking gameplay. I only wish it was longer. Gorogoa is stunning and meditative game that captivated me completely.

It‚Äôs supremely difficult for me to describe this Gorogoa in words, but it‚Äôs so, so good. You use four panels to navigate the main character through the game in a escape room-like experience that bends reality. (Escher‚Äôs work, Ames illusions, and the Droste effect came to mind when playing this game so I‚Äôm very curious if the creator was influenced by those things!)

The handdrawn artwork is meticulous and detailed. It‚Äôs hard to imagine that this game‚Äôs entire world was drawn, colored, and animated by just one person, because the sheer amount of planning and labor it must have taken is staggering.

There is a plot of sorts, but it‚Äôs on the nebulous side. I probably need to replay the whole thing to really get it‚Äîbut even without fully understanding it, I kind of got where it was going. It felt spiritual and time-transcending. 

If you‚Äôre someone who like to exercise lateral thinking (e.g. you like escape rooms, Rusty Lake, etc.), then this game is a must.
Have patience!  This is a meditation. It‚Äôs gorgeous and clever and a true accomplishment.

Basically I give this game a zero because the developer has failed to respond to my email. Afterwards I tried to get a refund but was denied.  I purchased this game on the basis of reviews however I have been extremely dissatisfied and disappointed with the app. 

If a person buys your product and you can‚Äôt even bother to reply to a request you should be removed as an app provider in my opinion.

title.label: Stunning artwork and unique but overpriced for play time

content.label: $4.99 for a game I spent 45 minutes on was not worth it.  Despite that, the art was spectacular and loved the thought provoking mechanics. Reminded me of The Room and that weird black cube series (can‚Äôt remember the name off-hand).  Get this if you have money to burn and can appreciate art and outside of the box problem-solving.

title.label: Text too small to read on an iphone

content.label: I can‚Äôt believe this app is getting good reviews. Even when I enlarge the image I can‚Äôt read one single line of the script font as the letters are the size of ants. Never seen anything like it. Refunded. I have no idea what it‚Äôs like on an iPad but the font is thin and scribbly and will be small under any circumstances, although I am sure better.

This game is a very pleasant, beautiful, and charming but ultimately boring and short puzzle game. The solutions never felt gratifying, and I never found myself really wondering how to solve a puzzle. The only Jess scratching came in the form of me not seeing all the pieces a few times, but when you see them all it‚Äôs very obvious. All in all it felt more like a walking sim than the puzzle game. It‚Äôs also not worth the money in terms of play time. I don‚Äôt know why this game is getting universal praise. The best way I can describe this is that it feels like Monument Valley but it lost the fun factor for better artistry.
Having played many of these type games, I found this to be too easy. Graphics beautiful. Gameplay lovely. Finished in a mater of hours.

I wanted to lgive vie this game. This kind of innovation and design is rare and delightful. But the game routinely crashes on my iPad and the last time it erased my progress, which is absolutely a dealbreaker. It‚Äôs such a shame that poor implementation ruined this otherwise excellent experience.
Too short.  Although, I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôd be satisfied no matter how long it went.  I loved every moment, and wished it wouldn‚Äôt end.
The game is crashing frequently.
I‚Äôve been enjoying this game, but the game crashing every other minute is maddening. No support on the developer website either, so I‚Äôm left with zero resolution, which is unfortunate.
Hands-down one of the best iOS puzzle games ever. The music and art create an absolutely gorgeous experience.

I bought this game because I found the illustrations so appealing, but it satisfies at every level. There are unusual puzzles with just enough challenge to slow you down, without becoming totally frustrating, and when you solve each one there‚Äôs a neat little payoff. The storyline was a little opaque, but maybe if I went through it again, I‚Äôd pick up more connections. Anyway, it‚Äôs excellent!

Really enjoyed playing this game. It was so enjoyable that I wish it was longer. I‚Äôve played a lot of puzzle games, but this one can truly be considered one of a kind. The graphics and art work were beautiful. 
If the creator came out with a similar style game, I‚Äôd enjoy one with a complex and mysterious storyline, or maybe another dreamlike fairytale story. Either way, I look forward to more work like this.

I sincerely appreciate the beautiful artwork and all the effort that went into this game. The ideas were clever, and I was able to figure out what to do despite the lack of tutorial. I enjoyed watching the story develop, too. However, for the price, the game is way too short. I finished it in under 2 hours. I was shocked when it suddenly ended. I would recommend the game, but I think it‚Äôs overpriced.

The artwork in this game is lovely, but as a puzzle it leaves a bit to be desired. First, for $5 the game is a relatively short one. Second (and perhaps more importantly), solution of the puzzle often involves, not so much the application of logic, but rather the semi-random shuffling around of pieces, a process I don‚Äôt find particularly enjoyable.

Usually do not have problems with games however I cannot figure out how to exit, return and continue. Every time I exit I have to begin from the beginning. 

Suggestions?

Too short. I finished it within a day playing it periodically. And by playing I mean fumbling around until something different happened. Not exactly sure what the story line is. Two stars for the artwork.
It was a good game, a bit of a learning curve. But it wasn‚Äôt long enough, and the ending was not what I expected. It was like sipping an ice cold soda, only to find out it‚Äôs flat and flavorless.
Although somewhat short (I finished in just a couple hours), Gorogoa is an intriguing puzzle experience for the price of a coffee. Definitely worth the money in my opinion.

title.label: Absolutely stunning but leaves a little bit to be desired

content.label:
First off I should say I would absolutely recommend this game. It does feel a bit short to justify the price but I don‚Äôt regret buying it. 

The art style, the atmosphere, and the music make this a one of a kind experience. (I would say the most similar feeing I‚Äôve gotten was playing Journey on the PlayStation.)

The only reason I have this 4 instead of 5 stars is the actual puzzles. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, the design and concept for the game are brilliant. The only problem I ran into is that a lot of the puzzles don‚Äôt feel very intuitive. It felt like I accidentally stumbled upon the answer instead of figuring them out for myself a bit too often. 
I think this is a problem that could‚Äôve been solved if the game was longer. By the time you feel like you‚Äôve got a good handle on how things work and what to look for the game ends. It sort of feels like a tutorial for a much longer game. 

Having said that, it‚Äôs a very minor nit to pick. I really did love playing this and would recommend anyone considering it to give it a shot. I‚Äôm really glad I stumbled on this game

This is a beautiful game with a very unique mechanic. Fun to play, but it is very short. I was able to get through it in about 3 hours, which is quite fast given the price tag. Still, I would say that it's worth it because it really is gorgeous and fun.
Although the story is well put together and the concept is innovative, this is a relatively easy game. I could play for hours on end if there were more stories.
Would be 5 stars if it wouldnt crash and make me start over all the time. Cant get more than a quarter of the way in

This is easily the most inspirational, beautiful, and ingenious game I‚Äôve come across. 

Like most story puzzle games, there‚Äôs a lot of thinking outside the box(es). 
BUT, unlike all the other story puzzle games, this one is very much like a novel you don‚Äôt want to end. 

It is both spiritual, nostalgic, dark, uplifting, philanthropic, and full of wonder. 
There‚Äôs a strong element of magic realism and dream quality to the expression that is both familiar and strange. 

And the art is just beautiful. 

I am so glad I played this game, I want more chapters to it!!!
‚ù§Ô∏è

title.label: I only wish I had turned off the tap hints mode!

content.label: This game is so beautiful! It tells such a story without words. Not unique but a rare find indeed. I only wish there was 10x more puzzles and art. I gladly would pay for future bonus levels and content. Well done!
I just move stuff around until it progresses. I‚Äôm currently stuck on a level where I‚Äôve done every combination. No thought process involved. Stupid  ‚Äògame‚Äô

title.label: BUGGY! Crashed and it restarted to the beginning.

content.label: I loved playing this game until it crashed on the 5th level and restarted me to the beginning without saving my progress. There is no ‚Äúsave‚Äù function in this game and it pushed me back to the beginning. I‚Äôm too tired right now to start again and wish they tested this before releasing. I wish I could get a refund.

Played for several hours and got pretty deep into the chapters, but when I tried to resume the next day I could not get back to where I was (the purple chapter after getting off the train.) The only chapters available to open were near the beginning and there were no other options. Even when I picked one of them I got a message that if I started there I‚Äôd lose my progress. I really like the game but I don‚Äôt want to start over every day!
This game was so good and I'm sad it's over! Please another one ASAP ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Gorogoa is beautiful and the puzzles are challenging and fun. It took me about 1 hr 40 min to play all the way through, and that time was filled with plenty of truly delightful ‚Äúaha!‚Äù moments. Totally worth the sticker price. Very cool premise/gameplay buttoned up in an intriguing story.
What a fresh and delightful game. I enjoyed this completely.
I was amazed, entertained, and engaged through every step of the game

When I had to click the zoom button on the first glass panel, It totally kicked me off the game. Every time I clicked that button it keeps happening. You need to update the game because When you come back it erases some of your progress or all your progress! P.S, I would like my money back, pleasssseeeee!

title.label: The stability needs to be improved

content.label: My iPad does not work with this game very well. Maybe it‚Äôs my device being too old, but it‚Äôs fine with other games.

As a long time comic and puzzle game fan I am ecstatic. the renderings are absolutely georgeous. the melancholy vibe is amazing. felt a bit sad when it was over but will play again and look for all the visual cues i missed
The music, the graphics, and the puzzles were the ones in my life
This game is great & very inspiring! A must-buy! Beautiful and not too easy! Keeps you so entertained!

title.label: Beautiful, but crashes constantly on iPad.

content.label: Warning - try the game as soon as you buy it or you won‚Äôt be eligible for a refund. I got to chapter 5 and then it crashed over and over, making me restart the entire game. I tried playing offline, online, restarted my iPad, deleted and downloaded the game again, but nothing helped. After replaying for the third time, now it crashes at chapter 3. And because I downloaded it more than 90 days ago, I can‚Äôt request a refund for the $8 it cost. Too bad, because it was a wonderful, beautiful game up until it crashed. I‚Äôm very disappointed.
This game is truly enjoyable, but I feel a little ripped off. For the price I would expect a longer experience, or at least a lower price.

Super well conceived and implemented puzzle adventure game. I bought this for a 5 hour flight and it did not disappoint.   However, I just wish it had lasted a little longer.   Can‚Äôt wait for the sequel!
Truly one of my favorite games. Please make more!
This game studio sold out its supporters and customers. Do not buy.
